title: The giant panda of the Washington Zoo enjoys the first snowfall
subtitle: The first snowfalls have fallen in Washington. This giant panda received the first flakes of the season thriving mercilesslyed by the snowy ground, climbing to the trees and enjoying the autumn thanks to its waterproof coat. This kind of bears do not hibernate because their bamboo-based diet does not allow them to accumulate the fat needed to spend the winter sleeping, like other members of their family.
text: Bei Bei, the Giant panda, enjoyed a day playing in the snow despite the heavy storms that swept his home at the Smithsonian National Zoo in Washington.
The storm, which according to the U.S. Meteorological Service ranges from the Ohio Valley to the mid-Atlantic, can bring more than 30 centimeters of snow in parts of Pennsylvania and new York.
